{"step_by_step_thinking": "The question asks about secondary colonizers of the oral cavity. S. sanguis, P. intermedia, Fusobacteria, and P. gingivalis are all species that can be found in the oral cavity. However, only P. intermedia is a true secondary colonizer, as it is not a primary pathogen but rather an opportunistic bacterium that takes advantage of existing lesions or compromised tissues to colonize.", "answer_choice": "B"}
